Message.Title: Short Interest
Message.Msg: I don't read all the posts on the board, and ignore some names. So, excuse me if my post is redundant...The most recent report shows short interest in YHOO fell almost 27% month over month, down to only 25M shares short. I think that indicates the potential risk vs the potential reward weighs in on the bullish side. And you have to suspect that a significant number of the short shares are hedged. Two trading days until we have the quarterly report and the potential for a hugh move up.

Topic.Title: Poll: Will Yahoo Meet, Beat or Miss Earnings Estimates?

Message.Msg: Those results are achievable for Yahoo because others are seeing strong U.S. online ad sales, RBC Capital Markets analyst Sean Kim wrote in a research note. At least one industry report in the last quarter pointed out that the ad partnership between Yahoo and Microsoft's (MSFT) Bing search engine has been attracting a higher click-through rate than competitors, including Google Beat by 4 cents

Message.Title: Yahoo, with 68 million users, has the third largest US mobile audience
Message.Msg: In fact, according to ComScore, Yahoo, with 68 million users, has the third largest US mobile audience amongst mobile app-makers, only following Google (100 million) and Facebook (78 million). It beats out Apple, Amazon, Rovio, and Pandora. Yahoo! Messenger has 28 million US users all on its own. Yahoo! Finance has 27 million.

Message.Msg: Marissa Mayer will have Yahoo at number 2 next year and number 1 by 2015.
